meanings.definition: A garment worn on the lower part of the body, covering each leg separately
meanings.sent1: He wore a comfortable trouser to the party.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of trousers for work.
meanings.sent3: The clown's oversized trouser kept slipping down comically.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was a ladder, with each step a different trouser to climb.
meanings.sent5: The colorful trouser stood out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To put money or something valuable in one's pocket or trousers
meanings.sent1: He would trouser his earnings at the end of each day.
meanings.sent2: She decided to trouser the precious gem for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: The magician deftly trousered the disappearing coin.
meanings.sent4: She would trouser her memories, keeping them close to her heart.
meanings.sent5: He would trouser his secrets, never revealing them to anyone.
